text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale I'm miss
opposable are in the kitchen I'm gonna
share with you my escarole salad with
black olives and homemade garlic
croutons I love the salad I have it just
about every time I eat pork chops
because in Italy we eat escarole with
pork chops it's just just all I know
that's what I know so that's what I do
the ingredients for it completely
ridiculously simple so let me take you
over them to get started you're gonna
need some fresh escarole that I have
just washed dried really well and cut
into large chunks some kalamata olives
pitted in half these are some cherry hot
peppers you're gonna need some stale
bread I'm using just some whole-wheat
baguette I've torn into small pieces
some garlic extra virgin olive oil white
wine vinegar salt and pepper that's it
now the first thing we're gonna work on
is the oops
straining time that's the first thing we
work on and turning on your stove now in
here over medium-low heat I'm going to
add a couple tablespoons of olive oil
and what I'm doing is infusing this
olive oil with the garlic which is why I
didn't cut the garlic because once the
olive oil is infused I'm gonna fish it
out and then once I fish it out show you
what the next step is this has been
cooking for about five minutes and I
think it's pretty much done its job I
could smell the garlic has gotten really
really fragrant you don't want to go too
dark otherwise it gets bitter
yeah I'll get rid of that don't worry
about that put your heat to medium to
medium-high we're gonna add in our bread
and now we're gonna cook the spread in
this garlic infused oil until all the
bread is a deep golden-brown and it's
nice and crispy that is the perfect
crouton now you can do this in the oven
by just using some garlic infused olive
oil that you buy at the supermarket and
then just toss it together and put it in
the oven 400 for 15 minutes or so I like
to do it this way because you really get
that fresh go
a flavor infused into the bread and it
really isn't much better than crispy
delicious garlic bread so just let this
go for a few minutes or until it's all
nice and toasted my croutons look
absolutely perfect just kind of turn
this off let that sit there for just a
minute while I pretty much finish up the
salad now I'm gonna just put in my
sliced 1/2 pitted kalamata olives and
now these are delicious cherry peppers
you can get them hot or you can get the
mild I like to get the mild because I
really love the flavor but I don't like
the heat so what I do is I just cut them
in half get rid of all the seeds because
the seeds is where all the heat is just
get rid of most of them anyway and these
are mild so they're not gonna meet as
hot as regular ones and then I'm just
gonna cut these up just like so and put
these right in last of our peppers I'm
just going to dress this with some extra
virgin olive oil some white wine vinegar
wouldn't dare use any other kind of
vinegar my mother would fly all the way
here from Italy just to tell me off
because with escarole you must use white
wine vinegar don't ask
so just season it with salt and pepper
to taste
always to taste now escarole if you've
never had it before it's a slightly
bitter green but you could substitute
any kind of lettuce you want just I
happen to love escarole with a
combination of cherry peppers and olives
it's what I'm used to so that's what
really works for me give this a nice
toss to mix everything together now I'm
going to add in my toasted bread and
this is going to slightly will the
greens which is going to be fantastic
once they soak up that oil and vinegar
you hear that ahh so excited to eat this
that's the hot bread against the cold
ingredients this may be gay making my
mouth water I'm just gonna plate this up
whoa
I make a mess while I'm at it
okay that is a-okay love this salad whoa
I just can't I'm so excited need the
bread it's just so good the combination
of flavors plus the texture from the
crispy bread and now garlicky background
it's out of this world I'm a huge salad
lover but I don't like boring salads and
this is definitely one with a really
really spicy attitude if you know what I
mean it's got it all top this with some
grilled chicken a side of pork chops a
can of Italian tuna and you have got
dinner in a pinch and it's just so
delicious
that's it simple it's easy it's
inexpensive you need to go to your
